com.hazelcast.internal.memory

Interface MemoryAllocator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable

    public interface MemoryAllocator
extends Disposable
    Manages the usage of an address space by allocating and freeing blocks of addresses.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static long NULL_ADDRESS
      The special value that does not correspond to an actual address and signals the absence of an address.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long allocate(long size)
      Allocates a block of addresses with the requested size and returns the base address of the block.
      void free(long address, long size)
      Accepts the base address and size of a previously allocated block and sets it free.
      long reallocate(long address, long currentSize, long newSize)
      Accepts the base address and size of a previously allocated block and "reallocates" it by either: Resizing the existing block, if possible.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.hazelcast.nio.Disposable

        dispose

    • Field Detail

      • NULL_ADDRESS

        static final long NULL_ADDRESS
        The special value that does not correspond to an actual address and signals the absence of an address.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • allocate

        long allocate(long size)
        Allocates a block of addresses with the requested size and returns the base address of the block. The contents of the block will be initialized to the zero value.

        Guarantees that no subsequent call to allocate() will allocate a block which overlaps the currently allocated block. The guarantee holds until the block is free(long, long)'d.

        Parameters:
        size - size of the block to allocate
        Returns:
        the base address of the allocated block
        Throws:
        NativeOutOfMemoryError - if there is not enough free memory to satisfy the reallocation request.

      • reallocate

        long reallocate(long address,
              long currentSize,
              long newSize)
        Accepts the base address and size of a previously allocated block and "reallocates" it by either:
        1. Resizing the existing block, if possible. The contents of the block remain unchanged up to the lesser of the new and old sizes.
        2. Allocating a new block of newSize, copying the contents of the old block into it (up to the new block's size), then freeing the old block.
        The part of the new block which extends beyond the size of the current block (if any) will be initialized to the zero value.
        Parameters:
        address - base address of the block
        currentSize - size of the block
        newSize - requested new block size
        Returns:
        base address of the reallocated block
        Throws:
        NativeOutOfMemoryError - if there is not enough free memory to satisfy the reallocation request.

      • free

        void free(long address,
        long size)
        Accepts the base address and size of a previously allocated block and sets it free. All the addresses contained in the block are free to be allocated by future allocation/reallocation requests.
        Parameters:
        address - base address of the block
        size - size of the block
